sentence.Network_en: The strike has taken on overtones of a civil rights campaign.
sentence.Network_cn: 罢工带上了民权运动的意味。

sentence.Network_en: Rather taken aback by such forwardness, I slammed down the phone.
sentence.Network_cn: 如此无礼的言语让我火冒三丈，我砰的一下把电话挂了。

sentence.Network_en: They were taken to hospital suffering from smoke inhalation.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们因吸入大量烟尘被送往医院。

encyclopedia.content: 布赖恩（利亚姆·尼森饰）是一名退休的特工，常年的特工生活使其与妻子女儿的关系越来越疏远，一次，女儿Kim（麦琪·格雷斯饰）想征得布赖恩同意去巴黎游玩，身为父亲的布赖恩并不放心17岁的女儿独自出行，在一番争吵后，固执的布赖恩终于答应女儿，然而在巴黎，Kim却遭到了黑帮卖淫团伙的拐卖，为拯救女儿，这名老特工重新出山。

entry.def: Taken is the past participle of take .

entry.tran: 对…感兴趣的;为…所吸引的
entry.def: If you are taken with something or someone, you are very interested in them or attracted to them.

example.ex: She seems very taken with the idea...
example.tran: 她好像对这个想法很感兴趣。

example.ex: I was quite taken with him when I was young.
example.tran: 我年轻时被他深深吸引住了。

means.word_mean: 1. understood in a certain way; made sense of;

sentences.sentence: "an open door interpreted as an invitation"

means.word_mean: 2. having possession gained especially by force or effort

sentences.sentence: "couldn't tell when he would be taken drunk"

list.explanation: 遭受重大经济损失，破产

example.en: These investors had been taken to the cleaners.
example.zh: 这些投资者都遭受到了重大经济损失。

example.en: took at this shirt! I was taken.
example.zh: 瞧这件衬衫!我受骗上当了。

Sentence.sentence: Remarkable changes have taken place in the book business.
It must have taken you a long time to fix up all these book shelves.
What is taken for granted by most people
According to Ruth Milkman, American craftsmanship, instead of disappearing, is being taken up by immigrants.
The recent economic crisis has taken the US by surprise
That these huge declines didn't lead to depression mainly reflects, as Romer argues, countermeasures taken by the government.
